text: When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

"Those innocent children are being punished for the sins of their parents." The newscaster on TV has announced the widespread findings: sudden early death, birth defects, and other issues in nearly 100% of the children and grandchildren of those who took the drug. 

 "I'll admit", you say, "I did lose sleep thinking about what 'could have been'. I thought about spending eternity with loved ones. There is always a price to pay though, and in this case, we would have hurt our own family. " "But we made the right choice, and I'm glad we did", she replies. "You have a good head on your shoulders, and a good moral compass. The kids are lucky to have you as their Dad." 

You look at your wife, and say "I'm glad we didn't take it." She reaches across the table and holds your hand. "I wouldn't trade our sweet grandchildren for anything.", she replies. You smile, and she smiles back. You've had a good marriage, and raised good kids. You both know that you've lived a good life.
